com.eduworks.ec.framework

Class OverlayManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.eduworks.ec.framework.ViewManager
      • com.eduworks.ec.framework.ScreenManager
        • com.eduworks.ec.framework.OverlayManager

  • public class OverlayManager
extends ScreenManager
    View Manager that manages displaying overlay views (views that take over the screen, but can be exited to return to the previous screen) with a few helper functions for managing overlays
    Author:
    devlin.junker@eduworks.com (NOT TESTED MUCH YET)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static EcOverlay startupOverlay
      Used if one of the startupOverlayCallbacks decides that it should be displayed on startup (usually using the URL to check what should be displayed on start)

      • Fields inherited from class com.eduworks.ec.framework.ScreenManager

        defaultScreen, LOADING_STARTUP_PAGE, startupScreen

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      OverlayManager() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void addStartupOverlayCallback(org.stjs.javascript.functions.Callback1<java.lang.String> callback)
      Adds a callback to be run on startup that can check if an overlay should be displayed (the callback should be defined in the overlay)
      static EcOverlay getCurrentOverlay()
      Retrieves the current view that corresponds to the Overlay Container Element (Should be a Overlay)
      static void hideOverlay()
      Hides the overlay container and sets the inOverlay flag to false, adds the last screen to the history array so there is a chain from initial screen to overlay (could be multiple) to initial screen.
      static void showOverlay(EcOverlay overlay, java.lang.Boolean addHistory)
      Set's the current overlay, then show's it by calling the display function and unhiding the overlay container.

      • Methods inherited from class com.eduworks.ec.framework.ScreenManager

        addHistory, addStartupScreenCallback, changeScreen, getCurrentScreen, reloadCurrentScreen, replaceHistory, replaceScreen, setDefaultScreen

      • Methods inherited from class com.eduworks.ec.framework.ViewManager

        hideView, showView

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • startupOverlay

        public static EcOverlay startupOverlay
        Used if one of the startupOverlayCallbacks decides that it should be displayed on startup (usually using the URL to check what should be displayed on start)

    • Constructor Detail

      • OverlayManager

        public OverlayManager()

    • Method Detail

      • addStartupOverlayCallback

        public static void addStartupOverlayCallback(org.stjs.javascript.functions.Callback1<java.lang.String> callback)
        Adds a callback to be run on startup that can check if an overlay should be displayed (the callback should be defined in the overlay)
        Parameters:
        callback - callback to be added to the startupOverlayCallbacks list

      • getCurrentOverlay

        public static EcOverlay getCurrentOverlay()
        Retrieves the current view that corresponds to the Overlay Container Element (Should be a Overlay)
        Returns:
        EcModal instance that is currently being shown in the Overlay container element

      • showOverlay

        public static void showOverlay(EcOverlay overlay,
                               java.lang.Boolean addHistory)
        Set's the current overlay, then show's it by calling the display function and unhiding the overlay container. Depending on the addHistory flag, will add the overlay passed in to the history array
        Parameters:
        overlay - The overlay to set as current and display
        addHistory - Flag for whether to store this overlay in the history array

      • hideOverlay

        public static void hideOverlay()
        Hides the overlay container and sets the inOverlay flag to false, adds the last screen to the history array so there is a chain from initial screen to overlay (could be multiple) to initial screen. This way we can press the back button and be shown the last overlay.
